skill.name: slack-gif-creator
skill.description: Toolkit for creating animated GIFs optimized for Slack, with validators for size constraints and composable animation primitives. This skill applies when users request animated GIFs or emoji animations for Slack from descriptions like "make me a GIF for Slack of X doing Y".
skill.summary: Toolkit for creating animated GIFs optimized for Slack, with validators for size constraints and com...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate Python GIF creation toolkit. It only performs local image processing using standard libraries (Pillow, numpy, imageio). No network calls, no credential access, no persistence mechanisms, and no obfuscated code detected.

content.value_statement: Creating GIFs for Slack requires meeting strict size limits. This toolkit provides validators to check file size and dimensions, plus building blocks like shake, bounce, and pulse animations to create engaging content quickly.
actual_capabilities: Validate GIF file size against Slack limits
Create 15+ animation primitives (shake, bounce, pulse, spin)
Generate emoji GIFs under 64KB strict limit
Build message GIFs optimized for 2MB Slack limit
Apply easing functions for smooth motion
Create visual effects like particles and explosions
limitations: Does not create GIFs from video files
Requires emoji-compatible fonts for emoji rendering
Does not support GIF editing of existing files
Limited to 128x128 pixels for emoji GIFs

use_cases.title: Team Reaction GIFs
use_cases.description: Create custom emoji reactions and team celebration GIFs for your Slack workspace

use_cases.title: Engagement Graphics
use_cases.description: Design eye-catching animated announcements and reaction graphics for Slack channels

use_cases.title: Status Indicators
use_cases.description: Build loading animations, status updates, and process indicator GIFs

prompt_templates.title: Basic Pulse GIF
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pulsing heart emoji GIF for Slack that is 128x128 pixels

prompt_templates.title: Complex Animation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a bouncing ball animation with particle explosion at impact for a 480x480 message GIF

output_examples.input: Create a 128x128 pulsing heart emoji GIF for Slack emoji
output: Uses 40 colors for optimal file size

best_practices: Test file size early and often during creation to avoid exceeding limits
Use 128x128 dimensions and under 12 frames for emoji GIFs to stay under 64KB
Combine multiple animation primitives for complex but optimized effects
Validate your final GIF with the check_slack_size function before uploading
anti_patterns: Using gradients or complex color palettes in emoji GIFs
Exceeding 20 frames for message GIFs without optimization
Ignoring file size warnings during the creation process
Skipping the validation step before uploading to Slack

faq.question: What is the maximum file size for Slack GIFs?
faq.answer: Message GIFs: 2MB. Emoji GIFs: 64KB strict limit.

faq.question: What dimensions work best for emoji GIFs?
faq.answer: 128x128 pixels is optimal. Range of 64x64 to 128x128 is acceptable.

faq.question: Can I use this with other image processing tools?
faq.answer: Yes, the toolkit outputs standard GIF files compatible with any image editor.

faq.question: Does this toolkit send data to external servers?
faq.answer: No, all processing happens locally on your machine.

faq.question: Why is my emoji GIF exceeding 64KB?
faq.answer: Try reducing frames to 10-12, colors to 32-40, and avoiding gradients.

faq.question: How is this different from general GIF makers?
faq.answer: Optimized specifically for Slack constraints with built-in validation.
